intro: Hedyotis korrorensis var. hosokawana, commonly known as the Japanese bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
